com.steelypip.powerups.jinxml

Interface PushParser

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StdPushParser

    public interface PushParser
    A PushParser is a wrapper around a Reader. On request, the push parser draws from that reader, incrementally parsing the input, and generates Events that can be directed to an EventHandler or simply returned. A particularly elegant use of a push-parser is to return an event stream, which will incrementally draw from the reader as events are taken from the stream.

      A convenience method that constructs a default push parser from a reader.
      Element readElement()
      Returns a single element constructed from the input stream, which is drawn-from on-demand.
      Stream<Element> readElementStream()
      Returns a stream of immutable elements constructed from the input stream, which is drawn-from on-demand.
      default Event readEvent()
      Draws from the input source to generate the next Event.
      Event readEvent(Event otherwise)
      Draws from the input source to generate the next Event.
      Stream<Event> readExpression()
      Returns a stream that will draw-on-demand from the input to return the events corresponding to a single JinXML expression.
      Stream<Event> readInput()
      Returns a stream that will draw-on-demand from the input to return events until the input is exhausted.

      Draws from the input source to generate the next Event which is sent to the handler.

    • Method Detail

      • readEvent

        default Event readEvent()
        Draws from the input source to generate the next Event. If the end of the event stream has been encountered then null is returned.
        Returns:
        the next event

      • readEvent

        Event readEvent(Event otherwise)
        Draws from the input source to generate the next Event. If the end of the event stream has been encountered then otherwise is returned.
        Parameters:
        otherwise - a default event (or null) to return at end of input
        Returns:
        the next event

      • readExpression

        Stream<Event> readExpression()
        Returns a stream that will draw-on-demand from the input to return the events corresponding to a single JinXML expression.
        Returns:
        the stream

      • readInput

        Stream<Event> readInput()
        Returns a stream that will draw-on-demand from the input to return events until the input is exhausted.
        Returns:
        the stream

      • sendEvent

        void sendEvent(EventHandler handler)
        Draws from the input source to generate the next Event which is sent to the handler. If the end of the event stream has been encountered then no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        handler - the event handler

      • sendExpression

        void sendExpression(EventHandler handler)
        Draws from the input source to send the events of a single JinXML expression to an event handler.
        Parameters:
        handler - the event handler

      • sendInput

        void sendInput(EventHandler handler)
        Draws from the input source to send the events of to an event handler. Continues until the input is exhausted.
        Parameters:
        handler - the event handler

      • readElementStream

        Stream<Element> readElementStream()
        Returns a stream of immutable elements constructed from the input stream, which is drawn-from on-demand.
        Returns:
        a stream of immutable elements

      • readElement

        Element readElement()
        Returns a single element constructed from the input stream, which is drawn-from on-demand.
        Returns:
        a single immutable element (or null if the stream is exhausted).

      • newPushParser

        static PushParser newPushParser(Reader reader)
        A convenience method that constructs a default push parser from a reader. JSON Literals are automatically expanded into start/end-tag events.
        Parameters:
        reader - the input
        Returns:
        a push parser

      • newPushParser

        static PushParser newPushParser(Reader reader,
                                boolean expandLiterals)
        A convenience method that constructs a default push parser from a reader. JSON Literals are automatically expanded into start/end-tag events depending on expandLiterals
        Parameters:
        reader - the input
        expandLiterals - if true then JSON literals are automatically treated as start/end tags.
        Returns:
        a push parser
